wikipedia_page.main: Audley Montague Miller (19 October 1869 – 26 June 1959) was an amateur cricketer who played one Test match for England in 1896, and stood as an umpire in two Tests, also in 1896.

response: Wiltshire has won the Minor Counties Championship twice, in 1902 and 1909.  The Edwardian years were the club's "most successful period" and a 1903 report described the team as "the equal of any first-class county".Barclay, p.494. Wiltshire's original captain, until 1920, was Audley Miller, also of Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC), who had played a Test match for England in South Africa in 1895–96.
* Audley Miller – MCC and England (1895 to 1903)
He died at Goring-on-Thames, Oxfordshire on 20 October 1962. His uncle Audley Miller played Test cricket for England.
